description: This app makes it so convenient to use other launchers seamlessly through the Steam Deck game mode. I can't imagine having to individually add dozens of games by hand, their images, etc... It's a must-have app on the Steam Deck and I'm so glad I found it.

I wish I had known about this app sooner! I tried to use Heroic Bash Launcher for a few weeks but it lacks a UI, takes up space in your downloads folder, isn't immediately obvious how to use, isn't available as a flatpak, and the kicker.... it doesn't work! (On deck, anyway)

Thankfully, BoilR works great and I see no reason to use anything else. Thanks a ton!
Works great, saves time updating the grid artwork.
Still crashes on images. Images when working doesn't change art. UI quirky and downloading text hides underneath the button text.

Boilr can't see games from EGS on steam deck. EGS installed through steam with proton. I know many people use Heroic instead, but I found it very unstable. Sometimes it works for some game and suddenly it doesn't anymore. So I'm forced to use EGS.
It just doesn't find any games, and gives zero explanation as to why.

Note: it won't list all the games/software that it finds, but it will update the art anyways. People who are saying it didn't find their games probably didn't actually hit the "import games" button and missed out.

Once everything is set it works great,adds games and their launchers and artwork. Only thing it's missing is Rockstar Launcher option to import their games to Steam. It did find art for the launcher though hehe yay
very useful tool but images tab keeps crashing the application, also not all games where found

It works great! Nice job. It's way more consistant than Steam Rom Manager. It finds all games, doesn't lag up or anything. I love that you can switch the art if it's pulling the incorrect art. Really excellent.

My one critique is that I just wish it didn't pop back to the top after choosing my game art.
I have 400+ games and it's kind of annoying having to scroll down for 30+ seconds each time for all 200 or so of the last games.
I couldn't imagine manually adding a picture for each shortcut that I create for my non-Steam games. Thanks, BoilR!
Unstable sometimes, but still amazing tool

used it to try and get a game installed through bottles to work but didnt find the bottles directory and stupidly had no manual directory entry so useless if you dont install everything on the internal drive because its common knowledge that swapping out the internal SSD is much simpler than swapping out an SD card, which explains why you cant specify a directory of your choosing even though you can in bottles...

doesnt uninstall properly either, everything you want in an application. 5 stars but not for what you think, its not 5 stars of competence put it that way
summary: not great if you dont use default directories

description: This was so easy to use on Steam Deck. My other computers have so many blank tiles and will need BoilR to help fix that. However, those installations are on different distros and the apps are installed natively. I wish it was as easy on those other distros as my Steam Deck!
